latest_week.brief_summary: Eight PRs merged including memprof race condition fix, DWARF detection support, and `#show_constructor` type parameter fix
latest_week.new_features_summary: DWARF version detection for Clang assembler, memprof race condition fix, and toplevel `#show_constructor` improvements
latest_week.new_features:
- **DWARF version detection** for the Clang assembler added to configuration system, enabling proper debug information handling and fixing `test-in-prefix` for other-configs tests ([#14314](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14314)) by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27)
- Fixed **race condition** between memprof and the minor GC detected by ThreadSanitizer, where memprof configuration fields now stored on major heap instead of minor heap ([#14300](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14300), [#14304](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14304)) by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche)
- Improved **`#show_constructor`** directive in toplevel to correctly print type parameters for non-GADT constructors by using actual constructor type parameters rather than type declaration parameters ([#14239](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14239))
- Always use `"I"` format specifier for `size_t` with mingw compilers, completing C99 stdint.h/inttypes.h fixed-width integer types migration ([#13656](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13656), [#14114](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14114), [#14308](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14308)) by [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA)
- **Native debugger tests** on Linux now skip when using Clang due to DWARF compatibility issues ([#14317](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14317)) by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27)
latest_week.activity_summary: Five new issues opened covering stdlib iarray oversights, manual page hierarchy, and compiler features; three issues resolved
latest_week.activity:
- **New issue discussions** this week included [Andreas Rossberg](https://github.com/rossberg) reporting stdlib oversights around iarray implementation ([#14320](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14320)), [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) proposing to reverse page hierarchy order in manual page titles for better navigation ([#14318](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14318)), and [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) requesting documentation for internal `Ctype.create_scope` function ([#14316](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14316))
- [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) opened feature request for **compiler support for static linking** of C dependencies ([#14313](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14313)) with discussion about build system integration and cross-platform considerations
- **caml_shutdown segmentation fault** issue ([#14319](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14319)) reported and resolved quickly by [@rwmjones](https://github.com/rwmjones), determined to be duplicate of earlier crash issue ([#14298](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14298))
- **Recursive functors** issue ([#14217](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14217)) by [Stefan Muenzel](https://github.com/smuenzel) received continued discussion about module aliases in recursive functor definitions
- Discussion continued on **configurable domain stack sizes** ([#14195](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14195)) by [Nathan Taylor](https://github.com/dijkstracula) and **parallel Sys calls hang** ([#14278](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14278)) by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid)
- Feature request closed: [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate)'s proposal to allow `open (struct ... end)` in mli files ([#13564](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13564)) marked as stale
- **Frame pointer tests** updated to normalize symbols for more reliable test results ([#14295](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14295)) by [Tim McGilchrist](https://github.com/tmcgilchrist)
- **Changes file maintenance**: [Zoggy](https://github.com/zoggy) fixed missing punctuation ([#14312](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14312)) and [Simon Cruanes](https://github.com/c-cube) added missing reviewers for earlier PR ([#14311](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14311))
latest_week.trends_summary: Focus on runtime reliability, build system improvements, and developer tooling enhancements
latest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Runtime reliability** improvements through ThreadSanitizer-detected race condition fixes, particularly in memprof subsystem ([#14300](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14300), [#14304](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14304)) and caml_shutdown crash resolution ([#14298](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14298), [#14319](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14319))
- **Build system and toolchain** enhancements with DWARF version detection for Clang ([#14314](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14314)), C99 integer type standardization ([#14308](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14308)), and discussions about static linking support ([#14313](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14313))
- **Developer experience** focus through better debugging support, improved toplevel directives ([#14239](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14239)), documentation enhancements ([#14316](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14316), [#14318](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14318)), and test infrastructure improvements ([#14295](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14295), [#14317](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14317))
- Ongoing attention to **multicore runtime** issues including parallel execution edge cases ([#14278](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14278)) and domain stack size configuration ([#14195](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14195))
- **Stdlib refinement** discussions around iarray implementation completeness ([#14320](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14320))

latest_week.contributors:

- [KC Sivaramakrishnan](https://github.com/kayceesrk) engaged in sanitizer CI discussions ([#13515](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13515))

oldest_week.brief_summary: Five PRs merged including new Thread.set_current_thread_name API and compiler improvements
oldest_week.new_features_summary: New Thread.set_current_thread_name function for setting thread names on supported platforms
oldest_week.new_features:
- New **Thread.set_current_thread_name** function allows setting thread names from within thread functions, available on most systems that support the functionality ([#13504](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13504))
- **Documentation improvements** for `-safe-string` option clarification in Bytes module interface explaining immutability invariant protection ([1e5d73946f](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/1e5d73946f8f1074afeffbf155869ed9a0ff70ef))
- **GC verbose flag documentation** reformatted with cleaner hexadecimal notation (0x001 instead of 0x0001) in Gc.control interface ([1e5d73946f](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/1e5d73946f8f1074afeffbf155869ed9a0ff70ef))
- **String.to_seq documentation** enhanced to clarify behavior in "unsafe-string" mode where modifications during iteration are reflected in sequence ([1e5d73946f](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/1e5d73946f8f1074afeffbf155869ed9a0ff70ef))
oldest_week.activity_summary: Core compiler maintenance with runtime events, typing improvements, and documentation updates
oldest_week.activity:
- **Runtime events enhancement** by [Thomas Leonard](https://github.com/talex5) with addition of `Runtime_events.EV_EMPTY_MINOR` event for better garbage collection monitoring ([#13407](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13407))
- **Memory documentation improvement** by [@andyhhp](https://github.com/andyhhp) adding discussion of `CAMLnoreturn` attribute usage in memory.h header ([#13561](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13561))
- **Local module type substitution fix** by [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) addressing issue [#13388](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13388) where local substitution could fail ([#13540](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13540))
- **Manual clarification** by [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) disambiguating the `-with-runtime` option documentation ([#12912](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/12912))
- **Testsuite cleanup** by [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) removing unnecessary string-bytes conversions for better js_of_ocaml compatibility ([#13550](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13550))
- **Ongoing modular explicits development** with [Samuel Vivien](https://github.com/samsa1) continuing work on [#13275](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13275), a feature for module-parametrized functions enabling convenient abstraction over higher-kinded types
oldest_week.contributors_summary: Multiple contributors delivered threading, runtime, and documentation improvements
oldest_week.contributors:
- [Thomas Leonard](https://github.com/talex5) implemented the `Runtime_events.EV_EMPTY_MINOR` event for improved garbage collection monitoring ([#13407](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13407))
- [@andyhhp](https://github.com/andyhhp) enhanced runtime documentation by adding comprehensive discussion of the `CAMLnoreturn` attribute in memory.h ([#13561](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13561))

- [@OlivierNicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) improved compiler documentation by disambiguating the manual description of the `-with-runtime` option ([#12912](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/12912))
- [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) cleaned up testsuite code by removing unnecessary string-bytes conversions that interfered with js_of_ocaml compatibility ([#13550](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13550))
- [Samuel Vivien](https://github.com/samsa1) continued development on modular explicits feature ([#13275](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13275)), receiving community feedback and working on implementation improvements

latest_week.brief_summary: Cmdliner vendoring work and 2.5.0~alpha1 installer support added
latest_week.new_features_summary: Installation scripts updated to support opam 2.5.0~alpha1 with checksums for all platform binaries
latest_week.new_features: - **Installer script support** for opam 2.5.0~alpha1 added with SHA-512 checksums for all platform binaries including Linux (x86_64, arm64, armhf, i686, ppc64le, riscv64, s390x), macOS (x86_64, arm64), BSD variants (FreeBSD, NetBSD, OpenBSD), and Windows ([#6748](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6748))
latest_week.activity_summary: Three new PRs opened for cmdliner vendoring across branches, one PR merged for OpenBSD static linking
latest_week.activity:
- **Three new PRs opened** for vendoring cmdliner 1.3.0 across different branches: main branch implementation by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) ([#6755](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6755)), backport to 2.5 branch ([#6756](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6756)), and backport to 2.4 branch for distribution maintainers ([#6757](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6757))
- **OpenBSD static linking** support merged by [bin](https://github.com/flumf) enabling `./configure --enable-static --with-vendored-deps` to produce fully static binaries ([#6705](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6705)), with [Sebastien Marie](https://github.com/semarie) noting architecture-specific limitations
- **Repository command enhancement** by [Francisco Santos](https://github.com/ProgramingIsTheFuture) adding `opam repo show <reponame>` command to display URL and rank information with `--all` flag support ([#6720](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6720))
- **macOS sandbox** long-standing PR continues addressing `/var/folders/` directory write permissions for `/usr/bin/security` compatibility ([#4797](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/4797))
- **Admin scripts cleanup** PR opened to remove unused admin scripts, with [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) noting continued utility of `iter_packages` mechanism for mass repository updates ([#6750](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6750))
latest_week.discussions_summary: Cmdliner 2.0.0 compatibility discussion ongoing with alternative approaches debated
latest_week.notable_discussions:
- **Cmdliner 2.0.0 compatibility** discussion between [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) and [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) on [#6755](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6755) regarding vendoring approach versus direct upgrade path, with [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) suggesting simpler workarounds using evaluation functions with `CMDLINER_LEGACY_PREFIXES` environment variable and custom `Arg.enum` implementation
- **Cross-compilation impact** raised by [Brian Ward](https://github.com/WardBrian) on [#6425](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6425) noting that cmdliner bound on `opam-installer` prevents simultaneous native and Windows cross-compilation in cmdliner 2.0 switches, with [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) proposing vendoring solution in 2.5.0~alpha2
- **Fedora packaging blocker** reported by [@rwmjones](https://github.com/rwmjones) on [#6425](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6425) with opam blocked in Fedora due to lack of cmdliner 2.0 support
latest_week.trends_summary: Focus on cmdliner dependency resolution and platform-specific build improvements
latest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Dependency vendoring** becoming preferred approach for handling breaking changes in core dependencies like cmdliner, balancing backward compatibility with modern library versions
- **Cross-platform build enhancements** continuing with OpenBSD static linking support and Windows installer updates demonstrating commitment to comprehensive platform coverage
- **Distribution maintainer coordination** evident through backport PRs and communication with Fedora, Debian maintainers for release packaging
latest_week.contributors_summary: Kate led cmdliner vendoring work and release preparation, with community feedback on approach and cross-platform concerns
latest_week.contributors:
- [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) opened three cmdliner vendoring PRs across different branches ([#6755](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6755), [#6756](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6756), [#6757](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6757)), merged installer support for 2.5.0~alpha1 ([#6748](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6748)), opened admin scripts cleanup PR ([#6750](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6750)), reported version number syntax preservation bug ([#6754](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6754)), and engaged in cmdliner compatibility discussions

- [Francisco Santos](https://github.com/ProgramingIsTheFuture) implemented `opam repo show` command feature ([#6720](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6720))
- [bin](https://github.com/flumf) contributed OpenBSD static linking support ([#6705](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6705))
- [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) provided review feedback on admin scripts removal ([#6750](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6750))
- [Brian Ward](https://github.com/WardBrian) raised cross-compilation concerns regarding cmdliner bounds ([#6425](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6425))
- [@rwmjones](https://github.com/rwmjones) reported Fedora packaging issues ([#6425](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6425))

- [Sylvain Le Gall](https://github.com/gildor478) and [Mehdi Dogguy](https://github.com/mehdid) were contacted regarding Debian packaging ([#6757](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6757))

oldest_week.brief_summary: Release of opam 2.3.0~beta1 with bug fixes, improved Windows support, and enhanced release infrastructure
oldest_week.new_features_summary: First beta release of opam 2.3.0 with bug fixes and platform improvements across Linux, Windows, macOS, FreeBSD and OpenBSD
oldest_week.new_features:
- **Release of opam 2.3.0~beta1** with comprehensive bug fixes and platform support improvements ([2.3.0-beta1](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/releases/tag/2.3.0-beta1))
- Fixed **VCS pinning regression** that stored untracked files in local VCS directories, resolving git submodule issues ([#6221](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6221))
- Fixed **platform compatibility** crash on OpenBSD where `getconf LONG_BIT` is unavailable ([#6230](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6230))
- Fixed **package cache corruption** storing wrong opam file versions after build failures ([#6213](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6213))
- Fixed **lint regression** W59 with local URLs that aren't archives ([#6219](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6219))
- **Enhanced Windows support** with fixes for OCaml 5.0+ compilation ([#6216](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6216))
- **Improved release infrastructure** including RISC-V Linux binary support and FreeBSD 14.1/OpenBSD 7.6 upgrades ([c7a1d9fc](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/commit/c7a1d9fc0605f907ada31e165779995273dd5477), [7a78925110](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/commit/7a78925110e0a6e005fc2c087d2fd0c7edf79a1a))
- **Updated install scripts** with 2.3.0~beta1 binary checksums for all supported platforms ([b600f1e88](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/commit/b600f1e88f779db90fd2f57e911b749449e510f4))
- **New documentation CI job** added to GitHub Actions for automated doc generation and validation ([f48edffd](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/commit/f48edffd118e8e50e8211a199c559c77162e1318))
oldest_week.activity_summary: Week focused on release preparation and infrastructure improvements with team coordination between Kate and R. Boujbel
oldest_week.activity:
- **Release coordination** by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) handling platform binary upgrades, release script improvements, and post-release documentation updates ([#6239](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6239))
- **Install script updates** by [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) adding 2.3.0~beta1 binaries with proper SHA checksums for platform verification ([#6238](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6238))
- **Infrastructure modernization** including Alpine Linux container upgrade from 3.13 to 3.20 for release builds and FreeBSD package manager interaction improvements ([43bc1a84](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/commit/43bc1a84d433e125d6ee03040aba54841d873985))
- **Documentation tooling** enhanced with new CI job for automated HTML and man page generation with validation checks ([f48edffd](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/commit/f48edffd118e8e50e8211a199c559c77162e1318))
oldest_week.trends_summary: Focus on release stabilization and cross-platform compatibility improvements
oldest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Release quality assurance** with extensive platform testing covering Linux (x86_64, ARM64, RISC-V, i686), macOS, Windows, FreeBSD, and OpenBSD
- **CI/CD enhancement** with automated documentation generation and validation becoming standard practice
- **Platform modernization** upgrading build environments and adding support for newer architectures like RISC-V
oldest_week.contributors_summary: Two core maintainers coordinated release activities with infrastructure and tooling improvements
oldest_week.contributors:
- [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) led release engineering with platform binary preparation, release script fixes, Alpine container upgrades, and post-release coordination ([#6239](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6239), [43bc1a84](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/commit/43bc1a84d433e125d6ee03040aba54841d873985), [c7a1d9fc](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/commit/c7a1d9fc0605f907ada31e165779995273dd5477))
- [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) handled install script maintenance and binary distribution updates for the beta release ([#6238](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6238), [b600f1e88](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/commit/b600f1e88f779db90fd2f57e911b749449e510f4))

latest_week.brief_summary: Configuration option for nested code lenses and improved metrics timestamp precision
latest_week.new_features_summary: Configurable code lenses for nested bindings and improved metrics precision
latest_week.new_features:
- New `for_nested_bindings` configuration option for **code lenses** allows users to disable code lenses on internal let-bindings while keeping them for top-level definitions, addressing user feedback about code clutter ([#1567](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1567))
- **Metrics timestamp precision** improved by switching from `Unix.time` to `Unix.gettimeofday`, enabling sub-second measurement of LSP request durations instead of always showing 0 for fast operations ([#1565](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1565))
- Updated **configuration documentation** with detailed information about the new code lens options including default values and version information ([d8c268dd9da65584c09fc8de7cd447ba3b72150d](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/commit/d8c268dd9da65584c09fc8de7cd447ba3b72150d))
latest_week.activity_summary: Ongoing PR for labelled argument autocompletion and dependency updates
latest_week.activity:
- [Tom Ekander](https://github.com/lessp) **opened PR** for autocompletion of labelled arguments with intelligent completion suggestions for variants and records, currently being evaluated for adoption at Ahrefs ([#1564](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1564))
- **Automated dependency updates** continue with flake.lock updates tracking changes to merlin 5.3 and nixpkgs, awaiting merge ([#1437](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1437))
- [Tim ats](https://github.com/Tim-ats-d) **merged** configuration option for code lenses on nested bindings after review discussion with [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) and [Xavier Van de Woestyne](https://github.com/xvw) about naming and semantic choices ([#1567](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1567))
- [Tim ats](https://github.com/Tim-ats-d) **merged** metrics precision improvements replacing one-second resolution timestamps with microsecond-level precision ([#1565](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1565))
- **OCaml 5.4 CI** fixes merged to maintain compatibility with the latest compiler version ([f03ef18a46220da80ce7451527bed2a01fd4610b](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/commit/f03ef18a46220da80ce7451527bed2a01fd4610b))
latest_week.discussions_summary: Discussion around document symbol range validation errors and code lens configuration
latest_week.notable_discussions:
- [Correnson Loïc](https://github.com/correnson) reported **document symbol range validation** error affecting version 1.23.0 where selectionRange must be contained in fullRange, likely related to previous changes in [#1529](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1529), with [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) requesting reproduction steps ([#1560](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1560))
- Design discussion on [#1567](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1567) between [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) and [Tim ats](https://github.com/Tim-ats-d) about **configuration option naming**, evolving from `only_toplevel` to `for_nested_bindings` to allow future extensibility for other code lens types
- [Tom Ekander](https://github.com/lessp) and reviewers discussing **practical validation** of labelled argument autocompletion feature at scale using Ahrefs codebase, with consideration for making it default behavior ([#1564](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1564))
latest_week.trends_summary: Focus on user experience refinement through configuration options and performance improvements
latest_week.emerging_trends:
- **User-driven configuration** becoming more granular with the addition of `for_nested_bindings` option responding directly to user feedback about code lens clutter, suggesting a trend toward fine-grained control over LSP features ([#1567](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1567), [#1561](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1561))
- **Metrics and observability** improvements with sub-second timestamp precision enabling better performance analysis and debugging of LSP request handling ([#1565](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1565))
- **Intelligent autocompletion** expanding beyond basic completions to include context-aware suggestions for labelled arguments with type-appropriate values, indicating movement toward smarter IDE assistance ([#1564](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1564))
- **Real-world validation** approach with companies like Ahrefs participating in feature evaluation at scale before general adoption, showing practical testing feedback loop

latest_week.brief_summary: One Directory per Package feature added, Dune self-pinning implemented, Melange improvements, and multiple bug fixes
latest_week.new_features_summary: Package directory isolation, automatic Dune self-pinning, conflict marker detection, and Melange compilation improvements
latest_week.new_features:
- **One Directory per Package** feature introduces `(dir ..)` field in `dune-project` to associate directories with specific packages, enabling automatic filtering with `--only-packages` and preventing package mixing in the same directory ([#12614](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12614))
- **Automatic Dune self-pinning** ensures the running Dune version is used for build plans, preventing incompatibility issues where `dune pkg lock` could select packages incompatible with the installed Dune version ([#12583](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12583))
- **Conflict marker detection** in cram tests now supports Git, diff3, and Jujutsu markers via `(conflict error|ignore)` option, preventing accidental test runs with unresolved conflicts ([#12617](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12617), [#12616](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12616))
- **Melange cmj/cmi rule creation** now parallelized for improved build performance ([#12626](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12626))
- Fixed `include_subdirs qualified` to correctly select the closest module rather than the furthest when resolving name ambiguities ([#12607](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12607), [#12587](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12587))
- Fixed `dune init` to work with absolute paths instead of crashing ([#12601](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12601))
- **OxCaml development environment** added with three Nix devShells for testing bootstrap, building with OxCaml, and running OxCaml test cases ([#12582](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12582))
latest_week.activity_summary: Ongoing work on OxCaml parameterized libraries, package management UX, RPC system refactoring, Merlin integration, and documentation restructuring
latest_week.activity:
- **New PRs opened** include portable lockdir platform grouping by [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs) ([#12620](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12620)), Melange `@all` alias fix by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) ([#12628](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12628)), ocamlobjinfo multi-file refactoring by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) ([#12623](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12623)), Merlin file loading fix by [Will Thomas](https://github.com/Durbatuluk1701) ([#12621](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12621)), promotion over non-existent file fix by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) ([#12615](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12615)), and symlinks in directory targets test by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) ([#12613](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12613))
- **Package management** improvements with portable lockdir solution display now grouping packages by platform to clarify version differences across platforms by [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs) ([#12620](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12620)), ocamlformat relock detection when version changes by [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs) ([#12605](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12605)), and toolchain cache using DUNE_CACHE_ROOT instead of XDG_CACHE_HOME by [Ambre Austen Suhamy](https://github.com/ElectreAAS) ([#11612](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11612))
- **OxCaml parameterized libraries** implementation progressing with instantiation support for library/executable dependencies requiring compiler support, introduced by [@art-w](https://github.com/art-w) with extensive refactoring across 48 files ([#12561](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12561))
- **RPC system refactoring** by [Ambre Austen Suhamy](https://github.com/ElectreAAS) includes fixing overly optimistic promotion behavior ([#12604](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12604)) and module renaming improvements ([#12585](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12585), [#12580](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12580))
- **Documentation reorganization** by [@sabine](https://github.com/sabine) restructures content with core concepts directory, flattened tutorial structure, and improved navigation with URL redirects for backward compatibility ([#12612](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12612))
- **Melange improvements** include test showing compilation isn't part of `@all` alias by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) ([#12603](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12603)) and markdown support for odoc without system by [David Sancho](https://github.com/davesnx) ([#12581](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12581))
- **Maintenance tasks** completed include Nix flake reformatting ([#12624](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12624)), package field decoding consistency improvements ([#12625](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12625)), bumping dune lang version ([#12608](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12608)), disabling timing out test ([#12622](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12622)), and GitHub Actions dependency update by [Dependabot](https://github.com/dependabot) ([#12602](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12602))

oldest_week.activity_summary: Three major PRs opened for index pages, sidebar overhaul, and frontmatter syntax plus active design discussions
oldest_week.activity:
- **Three new PRs opened** including index pages improvement by [Emile Trotignon](https://github.com/EmileTrotignon) ([#1221](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1221)), sidebar and index overhaul by [Paul-Elliot Anglès d'Auriac](https://github.com/panglesd) ([#1220](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1220)), and frontmatter syntax implementation ([#1210](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1210))
- **Index page improvements** delivered through driver-generated package pages with library and module listings, addressing need for better navigation when handmade index pages don't exist ([#1221](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1221))
- **Sidebar architecture** completely redesigned with unified tree representations across page, document, and unit sidebars, implementing smart content filtering that shows current page, ancestors, and siblings while avoiding overwhelming displays ([#1220](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1220))
- **Frontmatter syntax** development progressing with sexp-based approach for metadata like children order, short titles, and opens, though shifting toward existing `@-tags` syntax following [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli)'s recommendations ([#1210](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1210))
- **Planning phase** launched for odoc 3.0 infrastructure with [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) creating multiple issues covering opam metadata dependencies ([#1216](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1216)), markdown input support ([#1213](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1213)), deep sidebar JSON output ([#1214](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1214)), and driver compilation phases separation ([#1215](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1215))
oldest_week.discussions_summary: Detailed technical discussions on index page patterns, sexp syntax vs @-tags, and sidebar navigation design
oldest_week.notable_discussions:
- **Index page patterns** discussed by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) and [Emile Trotignon](https://github.com/EmileTrotignon) regarding automatically generated vs handmade pages, with emphasis on using section headings and `{!modules}` directives for better navigation ([#1221](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1221))
- **Syntax design debate** between sexp-based frontmatter and existing `@-tags` approach, with [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) advocating for consistency with existing ocamldoc language rather than importing new serialization formats ([#1210](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1210))
- **Sidebar behavior** examined by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) focusing on predictability and efficient use of horizontal space, suggesting separation of global content from unit-specific indexes ([#1220](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1220))
oldest_week.trends_summary: Focus on improving user experience through better navigation, standardizing metadata syntax, and planning infrastructure upgrades
oldest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Navigation enhancement** priority with multiple parallel efforts on index pages, sidebar redesign, and hierarchical content organization aimed at making large documentation sets more accessible
- **Syntax standardization** movement toward leveraging existing ocamldoc `@-tags` rather than introducing new formats, emphasizing consistency with established language conventions
- **Infrastructure preparation** for odoc 3.0 with comprehensive planning covering opam integration, driver architecture, and compilation workflow improvements

latest_week.discussions_summary: Policy debate on conf-mbedtls versioning remained unresolved while vsrocq packages faced conflicts resolution
latest_week.notable_discussions:
- **conf-mbedtls versioning semantics** generated extensive policy discussion in [#28742](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28742) by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) about whether version should represent bound on underlying package versus version of packaging, opam repository solver limitations with depext versions, and references to academic hyperres paper, ultimately closing without resolution and spawning alternative approach in [#28770](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28770) marked do-not-merge by [Raphaël Proust](https://github.com/raphael-proust)
- **vsrocq-language-server constraints** discussion in [#28761](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28761) by [@vscoqbot](https://github.com/vscoqbot) addressed installation failures from conflicts entries, maintenance intent requirements, and constraint refinement needs with input from [Enrico Tassi](https://github.com/gares) and [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid)
- **OCamlformat rapid release cycle** documented in [#28752](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28752) and [#28774](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28774) where two crash-inducing bugs discovered after 0.28.0 prompted quick 0.28.1 release with patches by [Jules Aguillon](https://github.com/Julow)
- **opam 2.5.0~alpha1 compatibility** issues discussed in [#28748](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28748) identifying revdep failures in odoc-driver, opam-publish, and orb with unbound values, leading to quick constraint fix PR [#28766](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28766) by [Marcello Seri](https://github.com/mseri)
- **Fedora 42 CI runner failure** reported by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) in [#28772](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28772) with all fedora-42-ocaml-4.14 jobs failing due to Docker hub rejection, resolved by retrying jobs
- **macOS 10.13.6 dune compilation error** raised by [Hsi Fun](https://github.com/manbaum) in [#28778](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28778) reporting AVX-512 ISA errors on older Intel CPU, discussion clarifying ARM Mac versus Intel architecture issues and proper repository for reporting
latest_week.trends_summary: OCaml 5.4 support expanding across tools while MirageOS ecosystem releases cluster with policy discussions on versioning
latest_week.emerging_trends:
- **OCaml 5.4 adoption** progressing with OCamlformat 0.28.1 adding support ([#28774](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28774)), codept 0.12.2 implementing compatibility ([#28780](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28780)), OCaml/Unikraft 1.1.0 supporting 5.4.0 ([#28750](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28750)), libbinaryen 117.0.0-b enabling OCaml 5 ([#28763](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28763)), while [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) marked 5.4 preview packages unavailable ([#28719](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28719)) and multiple constraint updates address compatibility ([#28745](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28745), [#28744](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28744))
- **MirageOS ecosystem coordination** evident with [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) releasing dns 10.2.2 with 13 packages ([#28739](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28739)), mirage-ptime 5.2.0 ([#28756](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28756)), arp 4.1.0 ([#28738](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28738)), opatch 3.0.1 ([#28720](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28720)), and conex 1.0.0 ([#28773](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28773)) showing concentrated development activity
- **Build system evolution** with ninja_utils 1.0.0 for Ninja build file generation by [Louis Gesbert](https://github.com/AltGr) ([#28724](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28724)), conf-ninja CentOS support then revert by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) ([#28741](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28741)) and [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) ([#28733](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28733)), and cure2 for re2 regexp generation ([#28743](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28743))
- **Policy and governance refinement** with maintainer documentation updated adding [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) officially ([#28762](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28762)), conf-mbedtls versioning debate generating multiple proposals without resolution ([#28742](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28742), [#28770](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28770)), and increased attention to version constraints and compatibility
- **Specialized tooling emergence** with ppx_matches introducing Rust-style syntax ([#28755](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28755)), regrade automated homework grading ([#28758](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28758)), pageantty terminal pager for diffs ([#28749](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28749)), ppx_minidebug debug logs with HTML output ([#28771](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28771)), and passage secrets manager ([#28754](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28754))
- **Template and DSL proliferation** including handlebars-ml for Handlebars templating ([#28730](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28730), [#28765](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28765)), huml-ml markup language parser ([#28727](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28727)), oglsl embedding GLSL ([#28731](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28731)), rich-string enriching string capabilities ([#28759](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28759)), and ocaml-dockerfile eDSL ([#28736](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28736))

oldest_week.brief_summary: Heavy week of package releases with 63 new packages added including major releases for YOCaml, opam 2.3.0 beta, and fixes for compiler installation issues
oldest_week.new_features_summary: New package releases for YOCaml static site generator, opam 2.3.0 beta, ActivityPub implementation, and Rust integration tools

oldest_week.activity_summary: Repository maintenance focused on package submissions and bug report handling with 4 issues closed during the week
oldest_week.activity:
- **Package ecosystem expansion** with 63 new package files added spanning diverse domains from static site generation to theorem proving and web frameworks

latest_week.discussions_summary: Technical discussions on cmdliner compatibility and ppx implementation strategies
latest_week.notable_discussions:
- **Cmdliner v2 compatibility** sparked discussion with [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) questioning necessity since jsoo is already compatible, while [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) noted the actual changes propagate exit codes and suggested consolidating exit points ([#2118](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2118))
- **ppx_optcomp_light improvements** received architectural feedback from [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) suggesting matching on signatures instead of individual items for consistency with structure handling ([#2117](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2117))
- **Wasm runtime export feature** discussion between [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) and [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) explored mechanisms for re-exporting JavaScript values, with proposals for annotations in runtime files or import namespace tricks ([#2086](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2086))
- **Patch release request** from [Nicolás Ojeda Bär](https://github.com/nojb) for including inlining fix from earlier merged PR ([#2107](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2107))
latest_week.trends_summary: Continued focus on OCaml 5.4 compatibility and Wasm runtime feature development
latest_week.emerging_trends:
- **OCaml 5.4 adoption** accelerating with test infrastructure updates and expanded test coverage demonstrating commitment to supporting latest OCaml versions ([#2103](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2103), [#2115](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2115), [#2116](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2116))
- **Wasm runtime maturation** with ongoing feature additions including JavaScript interop capabilities and runtime value exports showing increased investment in WebAssembly backend ([#2086](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2086), [#2108](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2108))
- **Tooling modernization** evident in updates to dependencies like cmdliner v2 and ocamlformat 0.28.1, plus GitHub Actions updates ([#2114](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2114), [#2118](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2118), [#2119](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2119))
latest_week.contributors_summary: Four contributors active with code contributions, reviews, and architectural discussions
latest_week.contributors:
- [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) fixed Wasm runtime floatarray concatenation bug ([1621a19](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/1621a19113ac2b89c0c018c305480101ad717d4b)), cleaned up test infrastructure ([#2116](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2116)), opened ppx_optcomp_light improvements PR ([#2117](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2117)), and continues work on Wasm runtime JavaScript eval access ([#2108](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2108)) and Oxcaml support ([#2105](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2105))
- [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) implemented OCaml 5.4 CI support ([#2103](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2103)), expanded test coverage for OCaml 5.4 ([#2115](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2115)), provided review feedback on ppx improvements ([#2117](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2117)) and cmdliner changes ([#2118](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2118)), and continues development on Wasm runtime value export feature ([#2086](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2086))
- [Sora Morimoto](https://github.com/smorimoto) opened PRs for cmdliner v2 compatibility ([#2118](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2118)) and ocamlformat 0.28.1 update ([#2119](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2119))
- [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) provided architectural feedback on cmdliner v2 PR regarding exit code handling and code organization ([#2118](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2118))
- [Nicolás Ojeda Bär](https://github.com/nojb) requested patch release for inlining fix ([#2107](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2107))

oldest_week.brief_summary: Complete removal of wasm_of_ocaml backend (~32K lines), sourcemap improvements, and enhanced weak reference runtime
oldest_week.new_features_summary: Major architecture change removing wasm backend, improved sourcemap index support, and modernized runtime features
oldest_week.new_features:
- **Complete removal of wasm_of_ocaml backend** (~32,000 lines of WASM-related code deleted), transforming the project back to pure JavaScript compilation ([4cd7df4](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/4cd7df45183ca6f590240eeb6f48c984fb925067))
- **Enhanced sourcemap support** with index mapping for linking multiple JS files together, improving debugging capabilities ([1e54c94](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/1e54c943918016553ed2ba6cf75abe29596b8833), [a0a03bd](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/a0a03bd67ecdf83a86350b9e5b391ceb39c9cf72), [6f38333](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/6f38333b2e704a615afd7dca0aab101f68052f73))
- **Modern JavaScript runtime optimization** using static `Object.hasOwn` instead of dynamic property checks for better performance ([1bc3ab8](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/1bc3ab8cde58915a35b4f2af59fae9c27f8dc392))
- **Improved weak reference handling** with complete runtime reimplementation for better memory management ([4cd7df4](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/4cd7df45183ca6f590240eeb6f48c984fb925067))
- **Global dead code elimination regression tests** added to prevent future issues ([4cd7df4](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/4cd7df45183ca6f590240eeb6f48c984fb925067), [ebc6c4c](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/ebc6c4c00ccfede2fff6890e2f9c81b8b91bf5a8))
oldest_week.activity_summary: Major architectural shift with extensive code removal and new feature request for Dom_html modernization
oldest_week.activity:
- **Complete architectural transformation** removing all WebAssembly compilation support in favor of pure JavaScript target, affecting compiler, runtime, and build systems ([4cd7df4](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/4cd7df45183ca6f590240eeb6f48c984fb925067))
- **Documentation rewrite** completely updating README from wasm_of_ocaml focus to comprehensive js_of_ocaml documentation with installation guides, feature descriptions, and data representation details ([4cd7df4](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/4cd7df45183ca6f590240eeb6f48c984fb925067))
- **Runtime system modernization** across multiple JavaScript modules including improvements to weak references, bigarray handling, and parsing functions ([4cd7df4](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/4cd7df45183ca6f590240eeb6f48c984fb925067))
- **Build system cleanup** removing wasm-related build configurations, test suites, and GitHub workflow files while updating opam package specifications ([4cd7df4](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/4cd7df45183ca6f590240eeb6f48c984fb925067))
oldest_week.trends_summary: Major simplification trend moving from dual JS/WASM targets to single JavaScript focus
oldest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Backend consolidation strategy** with the project moving away from dual compilation targets (JavaScript + WebAssembly) to focus exclusively on JavaScript compilation, simplifying maintenance and development efforts
- **Modern JavaScript adoption** with runtime optimizations using current browser APIs like `Object.hasOwn` for improved performance and compatibility
- **Enhanced debugging capabilities** through improved sourcemap handling, particularly for complex linking scenarios involving multiple JavaScript files
oldest_week.contributors_summary: Limited activity with one feature request by Jérôme Vouillon and ongoing experimental work by hhugo
oldest_week.contributors:
- [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) opened feature request [#1719](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1719) for auditing and modernizing Dom_html module, focusing on updating mouse event properties from int to float and removing outdated Internet Explorer compatibility code
- [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) continues experimental work on monomorphic representation for MlBytes in [#1229](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/1229), an ongoing draft PR from 2022 focused on runtime performance optimizations using deoptigate analysis

latest_week.brief_summary: Runtime improvements for threading and GC control, mode system enhancements, and compiler bug fixes
latest_week.new_features_summary: New GC tweak to disable SIGSEGV handler, phantom bindings support, improved mode error messages, and LLVM backend fixes
latest_week.new_features:
- **GC debugging control** added via `Xenable_segv_handler=0` tweak to disable SIGSEGV handler for better coredump analysis during segfaults ([#4913](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4913))
- **Phantom bindings support** implemented in Flambda2 allowing debug information generation without keeping dead code alive, controlled via `-gdwarf-may-alter-codegen-experimental` flag ([#3937](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3937))
- **Domain locking unification** merging backup thread and systhreads locks into single mechanism, enabling Python interop with multi-domain programs ([#4769](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4769))
- **Runtime4 TLS fix** for threads created via `caml_c_thread_register` ensuring proper thread-local storage initialization ([#4915](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4915))
- **LLVM backend** now implements `Dls_get` operation for domain-local storage access ([#4903](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4903))
- **Mode hint improvements** providing clearer error messages for allocation and regional mode errors with full hint chains ([#4917](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4917))
- **Regional mode printing** simplified to show "local to the parent region" consistently instead of special-cased "regional" ([#4918](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4918))
- **Compiler crash fix** for width checking in record types with crossing annotations preventing segfaults ([#4902](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4902))
- **Primitive simplification fix** resolving binding ordering bug when extra bindings were introduced during optimization ([#4923](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4923))
- **CI infrastructure** improved with proper commit message escaping to prevent shell injection ([#4907](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4907))
- **Build cleanup** removing unused `native/topeval.ml` file moving interface to bytecode-only location ([#4780](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4780))
latest_week.activity_summary: Runtime threading improvements, mode system refinements, and ongoing work on preemption, name mangling, and parsing features
latest_week.activity:
- **Preemption support** under development with 2500+ line draft PR affecting 62 files for concurrent execution control by [Aspen Smith](https://github.com/glittershark) ([#4881](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4881))
- **Name mangling scheme** in progress with reversible mangling for full module path reconstruction and demangling implementations for LLVM, Linux kernel, and binutils by [Tim McGilchrist](https://github.com/tmcgilchrist) ([#4850](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4850))
- **Crossing syntax parsing** adding `mod <crossings>` support for per-value mode tracking with 1100+ line implementation by [Zack Eisbach](https://github.com/zackbach) ([#4781](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4781))
- **Mixed modules with non-values** allowing automatic reordering of module fields to support unboxed types across module boundaries by [James Rayman](https://github.com/jra4) ([#4020](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4020))
- **Effect primitive refactoring** to remove `Must_not_enter_gc` module by making `%resume` take continuation directly instead of unpacked fields by [Aspen Smith](https://github.com/glittershark) ([#4901](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4901))
- **Backup thread locking improvements** extending `caml_locking_scheme` interface with better backup thread interactions for custom locking schemes by [Stephen Dolan](https://github.com/stedolan) ([#4914](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4914))
- **Quotation system fixes** addressing unification bugs in quote/splice handling for metaprogramming by [Leo White](https://github.com/lpw25) ([#4906](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4906), [#4911](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4911), [#4912](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4912))
- **Constructor quotation locks bug** fixing predef type checking to properly handle locally-defined constructors by [Zesen Qian](https://github.com/riaqn) ([#4910](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4910))
- **Frametable relocation optimization** proposing `.lrodata` section placement to reduce text section size and prevent linker failures under default code model by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) ([#4905](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4905))
- **CFG reducibility checking** and related terminator simplification improvements for backend optimization by [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) ([#4920](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4920), [#4921](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4921), [#4807](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4807), [#4879](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4879))
- **Untagged int arrays** implementation adding `int8#`, `int16#`, and `int#` array support with proper tag selection and indexing by [James Rayman](https://github.com/jra4) ([#4643](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4643))
- **js_of_ocaml integration** comprehensive test suite and CI updates for JavaScript backend testing by [Jacob Van Buren](https://github.com/jvanburen) ([#4753](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4753))
- **CI runner upgrades** enabling larger build machines for faster compilation and test execution by [Jacob Van Buren](https://github.com/jvanburen) ([#4908](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4908))
- **LLVM backend flag control** adding `-no-llvm-backend` option for selective testing by [Greta Yorsh](https://github.com/gretay-js) ([#4904](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4904))
- **Primitive list generation** tool discussion about auto-generating comprehensive primitive documentation by [James Rayman](https://github.com/jra4) ([#4812](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4812))
- **Debug information layouts** improving runtime type representation for flattened arrays by [Simon Spies](https://github.com/spiessimon) ([#4916](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4916))
- **Slambda IR development** introducing static evaluation phase between translation and lambda with trivial initial implementation by [Luke Maurer](https://github.com/lukemaurer) ([#4776](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4776))
- **Mode system refinements** including hints for containing types, global/aliased implications, and `Lambda.layout` usage by [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) ([#4919](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4919), [#4889](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4889), [#4582](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4582), [#4549](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4549))
- **Jkind subsumption test** reproducing cross-file bug for investigation by [Aspen Smith](https://github.com/glittershark) ([#4922](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4922))
- **Ikind system prototype** implementing new subsumption and mode crossing algorithms behind `-extension ikinds` flag by [@julesjacobs](https://github.com/julesjacobs) ([#4675](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4675))
- **VERSION file cleanup** removing installation dependency to match upstream OCaml by [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) ([#4924](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4924))
- **Typeopt level preservation** fixing unintended type variable level changes affecting principal typing and nullability by [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) ([#4549](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4549))
- **Lex directory removal** cleaning up unused lexer code and dependent tests by [James Rayman](https://github.com/jra4) ([#4925](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4925))
latest_week.trends_summary: Focus on runtime performance, type system refinements, and debugging infrastructure
latest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Runtime optimization** continues with threading model improvements, domain lock unification, and GC control enhancements targeting production deployment needs
- **Mode system maturation** progressing through improved error messages, hint chain completeness, and experimental ikind algorithms addressing polymorphic variants and GADTs
- **Debugging infrastructure** advancing with phantom bindings, improved debug layouts, reversible name mangling, and frametable optimization for large codebases
- **Backend diversification** expanding with LLVM backend fixes, js_of_ocaml integration testing, and CFG optimization improvements
- **Type system power** growing through crossing syntax, mixed modules, metaprogramming quotations, and untagged array support
- **Code quality initiatives** including cleanup of unused code, better CI infrastructure, and comprehensive test coverage

oldest_week.brief_summary: Repository restructuring with backend directory moved to asmcomp, plus runtime and flambda improvements

oldest_week.activity_summary: Major repository restructuring completed with backend directory moved to asmcomp, plus runtime issues addressed
oldest_week.activity:
- **Repository restructuring** completed by moving entire `backend/` directory structure to `asmcomp/` location, affecting hundreds of files including compiler internals, architecture-specific code, and debugging infrastructure
- **Runtime compatibility** addressed with [Leo White](https://github.com/lpw25) reporting OCAMLRUNPARAM=v=4096 flag overloading issue where custom timestamp behavior conflicts with upstream OCaml 5.1 changes ([#3158](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3158))
- **Flambda2 development** progressed with [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) closing continuation lifting issue after implementation completion ([#2413](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/2413))
- **Compiler optimizations** delivered through multiple PRs including string scope refactoring ([#3117](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3117)), directory flag refactoring ([#3120](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3120)), and debuginfo comparison improvements ([#3119](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3119))
- **Type system enhancements** completed with layouts documentation for contravariance ([#3144](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3144)) and unboxed vector types mode crossing fixes ([#3138](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3138))
- **Performance improvements** achieved through array reference kind refactoring ([#3152](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3152)) and block header field reordering reversion ([#3145](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3145))
oldest_week.trends_summary: Focus on compiler infrastructure reorganization and runtime system improvements
oldest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Compiler architecture consolidation** with major directory restructuring moving backend functionality into asmcomp for better organization
- **Runtime system refinement** addressing compatibility issues between custom extensions and upstream OCaml changes
- **Flambda2 optimization maturity** with continuation lifting and other advanced compiler optimizations reaching completion
- **Type system evolution** continuing work on layouts, modes, and unboxed types for performance improvements
oldest_week.contributors_summary: Two contributors active with issue reporting and closure
oldest_week.contributors:

latest_week.brief_summary: Configuration update to ignore additional LLVM-related compiler flags
latest_week.new_features_summary: Updated LLVM flag handling to ignore `-llvm-backend`, `-no-llvm-backend`, and moved `-llvm-path` to parametrized flags
latest_week.new_features: - Updated **LLVM flag handling** in the configuration module to ignore `-llvm-backend` and `-no-llvm-backend` flags, and moved `-llvm-path` from simple ignored flags to parametrized ignored flags for better compiler compatibility ([#192](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/192))
latest_week.activity_summary: Single configuration improvement merged for LLVM flag compatibility
latest_week.activity: - **LLVM flag compatibility** improved by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) through updates to ignored compiler flags in `src/kernel/mconfig.ml`, adding support for `-llvm-backend` and `-no-llvm-backend` while reclassifying `-llvm-path` as a parametrized flag ([#192](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/192))
latest_week.contributors_summary: Single contributor made configuration improvements for LLVM flag handling
latest_week.contributors: - [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) updated the configuration module to properly handle LLVM-related compiler flags, ensuring Merlin correctly ignores `-llvm-backend`, `-no-llvm-backend`, and treats `-llvm-path` as a parametrized flag ([#192](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/192))

oldest_week.brief_summary: Enhanced locate command with context overrides and merged major OCaml 5.2.0minus-1 changes plus tooling improvements
oldest_week.new_features_summary: New `-context` flag for locate command enables precise namespace searching and automated magic number update script
oldest_week.new_features:
- Enhanced **locate command** with new `-context` flag allowing explicit namespace specification via values like `expr`, `module_path`, `type`, `constructor`, `label`, etc., overriding context inference ([#91](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/91))
- New **magic numbers update script** (`update-magic-numbers.sh`) for automated OCaml version compatibility maintenance, automatically syncing magic numbers from upstream OCaml flambda configuration ([#108](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/108))
- Fixed **EXCLUDE_QUERY_DIR directive** handling for cmt/cms files, ensuring proper directory exclusion behavior during indexing ([#104](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/104))
- Improved **ghost location handling** in occurrences query by switching from ghost location filtering to `Location.none` filtering, better supporting let punning and PPX-generated code ([#110](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/110))
oldest_week.activity_summary: Multiple infrastructure improvements including OCaml 5.2.0minus-1 merge and cleanup of unused magic numbers
oldest_week.activity:
- **Locate command enhancement** completed by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) adding flexible context override capability for precise namespace searches, enabling users to specify exact identifier search contexts rather than relying on position inference ([#91](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/91))
- **OCaml 5.2.0minus-1 integration** delivered through comprehensive upstream merge by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923), bringing latest flambda backend changes while temporarily deferring parameterized module support ([#106](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/106))
- **Development tooling improved** with new automated magic numbers update script by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923), streamlining OCaml version compatibility maintenance with validation and error checking ([#108](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/108))
- **Code cleanup completed** by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) removing unused magic numbers from configuration, reducing maintenance overhead and potential confusion ([#107](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/107))
- **Bug fix implemented** by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) for EXCLUDE_QUERY_DIR directive handling in cmt/cms files, with intention to upstream the fix to main OCaml merlin ([#104](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/104))
- **Occurrences query improvement** merged by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) switching from ghost location to `Location.none` filtering, coordinated with related [ocaml-flambda/flambda-backend#3137](https://github.com/ocaml-flambda/flambda-backend/issues/3137) changes ([#110](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/110))
oldest_week.trends_summary: Focus on OCaml compatibility and development workflow improvements with coordination across repositories
oldest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Cross-repository coordination** evident through synchronization between merlin and [ocaml-flambda/flambda-backend](https://github.com/ocaml-flambda/flambda-backend) projects, particularly for occurrences filtering changes and upstream integration planning
- **Development automation** emphasis with creation of tooling for automated magic numbers maintenance, reducing manual overhead for OCaml version updates
- **User experience improvements** through enhanced locate command functionality providing more precise control over identifier resolution in complex codebases
oldest_week.contributors_summary: Primary development by Liam Stevenson with review participation from Nick Roberts and Richard Eisenberg
oldest_week.contributors:
- [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) implemented all merged features including locate command enhancement ([#91](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/91)), OCaml 5.2.0minus-1 integration ([#106](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/106)), automated magic numbers script ([#108](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/108)), code cleanup ([#107](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/107)), bug fix ([#104](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/104)), and occurrences improvement ([#110](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/110))
- [Nick Roberts](https://github.com/ncik-roberts) provided code review feedback and suggestions for magic numbers handling improvements ([#107](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/107), [#108](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/108))
- [Richard Eisenberg](https://github.com/goldfirere) participated in review discussions for occurrences query changes, coordinating with flambda-backend dependencies ([#110](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/110))

oldest_week.brief_summary: Ten PRs merged focusing on performance optimizations and hash table enhancements
oldest_week.new_features_summary: Hash table gained consensus protocol operations and improved Trigger documentation
oldest_week.new_features:
- **Hash table consensus operations** added comprehensive set of atomic operations including `try_set`, `try_compare_and_set`, `set_exn`, `try_compare_and_remove` designed for building consensus protocols over arbitrary numbers of processes ([#317](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/317))
- **Trigger documentation improvements** with enhanced explanations of scheduler interface and added usage notes for `Trigger.from_action` ([#318](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/318))
- **Documentation navigation** improvements by moving libraries section to top of index page for quicker access ([#313](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/313))
- **Development tooling** enhancement ensuring `sherlodoc` installation for proper documentation search functionality ([#315](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/315))
oldest_week.activity_summary: Single contributor focused on performance optimizations and platform consistency improvements
oldest_week.activity:
- **Performance optimization series** delivered through multiple PRs by [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic) including fast path tweaks for computation waiting/peeking ([#310](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/310)), stack usage reduction ([#311](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/311), [#312](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/312)), and inlining improvements ([#309](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/309))
- **External dependency integration** with removal of internal `Countdown` implementation in favor of using version from `multicore-bench` library ([#316](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/316))
- **Experimental performance work** exploring CPU relaxation during yielding to reduce contention, though this approach was closed without merging after showing no measurable effect ([#303](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/303))
oldest_week.discussions_summary: Documentation feedback discussion on Trigger module clarity and English usage
oldest_week.notable_discussions: - **Documentation feedback exchange** between [Carine Morel](https://github.com/lyrm) and [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic) covering Trigger module documentation clarity, particularly around grammatical usage of "and" vs "or" connectors, alert handler formatting, and explanation of engineering terminology like "problem domain" ([#39](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/39))
oldest_week.issues_summary: Documentation feedback issue available for community contributions
oldest_week.good_first_issues: - **Documentation improvements** sought for better clarity in module explanations, with specific feedback welcomed on areas that may be unclear to users less familiar with the codebase ([#39](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/39))
oldest_week.contributors_summary: Primary development by Vesa Karvonen with documentation feedback from Carine Morel
oldest_week.contributors:
- [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic) implemented all code changes including hash table enhancements ([#317](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/317)), performance optimizations across multiple PRs ([#309](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/309), [#310](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/310), [#311](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/311), [#312](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/312)), documentation improvements ([#313](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/313), [#315](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/315), [#318](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/318)), and external library integration ([#316](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/316))
- [Carine Morel](https://github.com/lyrm) provided detailed documentation feedback on Trigger module clarity and readability, contributing to improved user experience ([#39](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/39))

oldest_week.brief_summary: Fork action header exposed for external libraries and Windows symlink test improvements merged
oldest_week.new_features_summary: Made fork_action.h public header for external libraries and improved Windows symlink test compatibility
oldest_week.new_features:
- **Public header exposure** for `fork_action.h` enabling external libraries to provide new fork actions by [Patrick Ferris](https://github.com/patricoferris) ([#769](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/769))
- **Windows symlink test compatibility** check using `Unix.has_symlink()` to skip symlink tests on systems without support by [Onah_Anthony](https://github.com/create2000) ([#771](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/771))
oldest_week.activity_summary: New PRs opened for Process.pipe type relaxation and Windows test improvements, ongoing Windows compatibility work
oldest_week.activity:
- **New PRs opened** include Process.pipe type relaxation by [Isaac Arogbonlo](https://github.com/Arogbonlo) ([#767](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/767), [#770](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/770)) and Windows symlink test improvements by [Onah_Anthony](https://github.com/create2000) ([#766](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/766), [#768](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/768))
- **Windows compatibility** work continues with native implementation attempts by [Kento Okura](https://github.com/kentookura) ([#738](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/738)) and test suite enablement efforts ([#761](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/761))
- **Type system improvements** discussed around `Eio.Process.pipe` return types for better API compatibility with monomorphic types ([#750](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/750))
oldest_week.trends_summary: Focus on Windows compatibility and type system flexibility for better external library integration
oldest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Windows platform support** receiving increased attention with multiple contributors working on test compatibility ([#761](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/761), [#766](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/766), [#768](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/768), [#771](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/771), [#738](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/738))
- **External library integration** improvements with public header exposure for fork actions ([#769](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/769))
- **Type system flexibility** work to improve API compatibility between Eio and external libraries like Cohttp ([#750](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/750), [#767](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/767), [#770](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/770))
